overview.title: Overview
items: Equity markets and forex/CFD markets often move in relation to one another, with shifts in one influencing the other.
This correlation arises from macroeconomic drivers such as growth expectations, interest rates, risk appetite, and global capital flows.
Understanding these linkages helps traders build better strategies for diversification and hedging across asset classes.

items.label: Interest Rates:
items.text: Central bank policies affect both currencies and equities—rising rates can strengthen currencies but pressure stock valuations.

items.label: Economic Data:
items.text: Strong GDP, employment, and inflation figures influence investor sentiment in both markets, aligning their direction.

items.label: Global Risk Sentiment:
items.text: During risk-off conditions, investors exit equities and move into safe-haven FX like JPY and CHF; risk-on phases reverse this.

items.label: Capital Flows:
items.text: Cross-border investments into equity markets boost local currency demand, while outflows can weaken it.

common.title: Common Correlations Between Equities and Forex/CFDs

positive.title: Positive Correlations
items: USD and US Equities: A robust economy can lift both the dollar and stock markets as investors expect strong growth.
AUD and Commodity Stocks: Australia’s resource-linked currency tends to move with mining and energy equities.

negative.title: Negative Correlations
items: JPY and Japanese Equities: The yen often strengthens when Japanese equities fall as capital returns home during risk aversion.
CHF and Global Equities: The Swiss franc typically gains when global stocks drop, reflecting flight-to-safety behavior.

impact.title: How Equity Markets Impact Forex/CFD Markets

rallies.title: Stock Market Rallies and Currency Strength
items: When equity markets rise, capital inflows can drive up the local currency as investors seek exposure to growth.
Positive equity performance boosts confidence, attracting foreign investment and supporting currency appreciation.

declines.title: Equity Market Declines and Safe-Haven Currencies
items: Market downturns trigger moves into safe-haven currencies such as USD, JPY, and CHF, pushing them higher.
During crises, investors reduce risk exposure and shift funds from equities to stable currencies to preserve capital.

benefits.title: Benefits of Understanding Equity and Forex/CFD Correlations
items: Improves diversification by managing risk across asset classes.
Supports better timing by understanding how one market influences another.
Helps identify hedging opportunities to offset potential losses.

items.label: Unpredictable Changes:
items.text: Correlations can shift rapidly in response to policy shifts or global shocks, reducing their reliability.

items.label: Market-Specific Factors:
items.text: Local events such as earnings reports or political risks can distort typical patterns between markets.

items.label: Complex Interdependencies:
items.text: Multiple macro and micro forces interact, making correlations dynamic and time-dependent.
